channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Candy is dandy but trick or treat for UNICEF has heft. And this year it turns 75!

item.description: President Trump said he and Chinese leader Xi Jinping "agreed to almost everything" in their nearly two-hour meeting in South Korea, which Trump said ...

item.title: Trump suggests the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Donald Trump appeared to suggest the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in three decades, saying it would be on an ...

item.title: Trump pushes an end to medical care for transgender youth nationally
item.description: The White House plans to bar hospitals that treat transgender children and youth from getting any Medicare and Medicaid payments. The move would affec...

item.title: Trump lowers China's tariffs. And, what to know for Casey Means' confirmation hearing

item.title: Trump hails 'amazing' meeting with China's Xi but no formal trade deal agreed
item.description: The US president and his Chinese counterpart met face-to-face for the first time in six years.

item.title: Hurricane leaves trail of destruction across Caribbean
item.description: The storm has been downgraded from a Category 5 to a Category 2 storm but is gathering speed.

item.title: Erika Kirk’s words spotlight forgiveness in a divided nation
New Trump administration rule bars student loan relief for public workers tied to ‘illegal’ activity
item.description: The Trump administration is forging ahead with plans to eject some nonprofits from a popular student loan forgiveness program if their work is deemed ...

item.title: Trump directs nuclear weapons testing to resume for first time in over 30 years
item.description: It is necessary for the US to keep pace with weapons programmes in China and Russia, the president says.

item.title: Judge to consider demand to force the government to keep funding SNAP food aid despite the shutdown

item.title: Border Patrol takes lead role in Chicago crackdown, carrying out more arrests than ICE
item.description: Border Patrol agents have been responsible for more Chicago-area arrests than ICE amid "Midway Blitz," an unprecedented shift that has caused some int...

item.title: SNAP funding is set to lapse on Nov. 1. Here's what to know.
item.description: With food-stamp funding set to lapse Saturday, recipients are asking what happens to their benefits — and when help might resume.

item.title: Sudan RSF chief promises investigation as anger mounts over el-Fasher killings
item.description: The announcement comes after growing reports of mass killings, including of patients at a hospital.

item.title: Dutch centrist liberals neck and neck with populist Wilders in tight election
item.description: Rob Jetten's D66 party celebrates but with most of the votes counted the result is too close to call.

item.title: Senate talks continue over ending shutdown as Trump returns to D.C.
item.description: Senators have expressed cautious optimism over bipartisan talks to end the shutdown, now on Day 30. Follow live updates here.
